q: shake-up. Current Google CEO Eric Schmidt will serve as the company's executive chairman. Co-founder Sergey Brin will devote his time to strategic projects, in particular working on new products, the company said. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a statement. "By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited

Vote-casting at the factory, which employs around 5,500 people, began on Thursday evening. Early estimates put voting turnout at 94.4 percent. The results of the ballot were expected around 2300 GMT. The voting slips that have been slipped into the factory's ballot boxes since yesterday are destined to change the country's industrial history, Silvio Berlusconi Sole 24 Ore business paper said in an editorial on Friday.
